notes_display: Hole at 12 h; Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Narseh on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: arcaded crown surmounted; covered korymbos; plain diadem, diadem ribbons pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double lines running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; altar ribbons, hanging downwards; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical lines; to the left of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Narseh, holding a barsom in his left hand, right hand resting on his scabbard, to the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Ahuramazda, holding a barsom with both hands, both facing inwards; dotted border
